byline.contributor: Noah Smith reported from Oxnard, and Jack Healy from Los Angeles. Russ Buettner contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By NOAH SMITH and JACK HEALY

abstract: Metrolink commuter train crashes into truck stopped on tracks in Oxnard, Calif, derailing rail cars, igniting fire and causing injuries to at least 28 people, four of them critical; intersection was site of fatal 2014 collision between Amtrak train and car, underscoring danger of crossing.
lead_paragraph: Several rail cars derailed, and some people were critically injured, when the commuter train hit a vehicle that was stuck on the tracks at a crossing in Oxnard.

headline.main: Metrolink Train Headed to Los Angeles Crashes Into Truck, Injuring Dozens
headline.print_headline: Dozens Injured as Commuter Train Hits Truck

snippet: Several rail cars derailed, and some people were critically injured, when the commuter train hit a vehicle that was stuck on the tracks at a crossing in Oxnard.
